result.execSummary:
The defendant Loren Christopher Bowen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:54 PM 
Defendant Loren Christopher Bowen in court.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Loren Christopher Bowen.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Murphy Informs the court this matter is resolved and files plea questionnaire and waiver of rights with the court.
Defendant enters plea of "NO CONTEST" - Both Counts .
Court questions defendant re: his plea and waiver of rights.
Court questions attorney Witt re: his clients plea and waiver of rights.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY". 

State moves for joint recommendation of the parties.
Attorney Murphy joins in the States motion.

Court Orders: Sentence Withheld Probation for a Period of 1 Year
-Costs

Court Orders:
-$1,000.00 Signature Bond
-Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with Carrie Schaar or the residence located at 115 West Church Street, in the City of Shullsburg, Lafayette County, Wisconsin.
-Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
-Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
-Defendant shall participate in bail monitoring with John Shulta, Lafayette County Court Services Coordinator.
-Defendant shall agree to random or possibly daily drug testing ordered by John Shulta.

Defendant shall be permitted to go to the residence with law enforcement for a 1 time pick up of personal property.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
